reg:regulation.reg:title:
Direction to the British Columbia
Utilities Commission Respecting
the Iskut Extension Project
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 24/2019, February 14, 2019]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this direction, Act means the Utilities Commission Act.
This direction is issued to the commission under section 3 of the Act.
The commission must not exercise its powers under sections 45 (5) of the Act in respect of the following extensions of the authority's plant or system:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a new distribution line from the Tatogga substation to the community of Iskut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In setting rates for the authority under the Act, the commission must ensure that the rates allow the authority to collect sufficient revenue to recover its costs incurred in relation to the extensions referred to in section 3, including, without limitation, costs incurred negotiating, entering into and carrying out agreements with first nations.

bcl:lefttext.in:em:
The draft agreement previously referred to in section 4 (1) is not included in this consolidation.
The text of the agreement is available to read in Volume 56, No. 5 of the The British Columbia Gazette, Part II and online at www.bclaws.ca.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Utilities Commission Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 473, s. 3]
